repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: Charles D. Wrege Research Papers Regarding History of Management
did.abstract: Charles Wrege's research material, correspondence, some government publications, experiment data and miscellaneous research material used to write his papers.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Charles "Chuck" Wrege finished his undergraduate degree in Upsala College, obtained his Masters degree at the New School fo Social Research and another Masters of Business Administration and his Ph.D. at NYU. He taught industrial management at Rutgers University for 30 years. He became a renowned historian, researcher and writer. He is regarded as a "National Treasure" by many in his field because of his expertise and the seminal research he has done in the area of management history.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles D. Wrege Research Papers Regarding History of Management #5618. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 5930 mf: Morris L. Cooke "Industrial Management" Monograph on Microfilm
